DOC.brief_title: Optimizing Technique Embryo Transfer IVF Using Better Imaging Guidance
DOC.detailed_description: Since first pregnancy use IVF achieve nearly 40 year ago , many aspect procedure undergone significant progress . In contrast , technique embryo transfer ( ET ) remain relatively unchanged . A simple yet critical element final step IVF , ET receive little attention . In general , procedure start place speculum vagina visualize cervix , cleanse saline solution culture medium . A transfer catheter load embryos inserted cervical canal advance uterine cavity embryo deposit . The catheter withdrawn hand embryologist , inspects retain embryos . Ultrasound ( US ) guidance use facilitate atraumatic insertion catheter , well ensure correct location uterine cavity . The available evidence suggest benefit use US guidance ET ( Teixeira et al , Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol . 201 ; 45:139-48 , Abou-Setta et al , Fertil Steril . 2007 ; 88:333-41 ) . High quality US image difficult achieve distance abdominal wall uterus big ( thick abdominal wall , retro-verted uterus ) , bladder full enough . High resolution US image dictate short distance US transducer organ interest ( case cervical canal endometrium ) . Previous effort direction do use vaginal US probe . However , instrumentation make ET technique cumbersome difficult perform . We hypothesize significant advantage image quality achieve place flat concave high frequency US transducer posterior fornix extension posterior speculum blade . Our overarch goal develop new ET procedure ; procedure dependent precise high resolution imaging . For goal consult ultrasound expert recommend use dedicated probe . After thorough review find probe ( Philips 21381A / T6207 ) use pediatric transesophageal application operate frequency 4-7 Megahetz . As part embryo transfer , investigator plan insert probe posterior fornix . The investigator evaluate visualization ability place probe close uterus . The aim define ultrasound image parameter ET . The information use define technical specification `` tailor make '' ET probe .
